page.title: 16FARMS - HARDINGS
page.content: Hardings farm belongs to a man by the name of Mr. David Morris. Hardings is just one part of the farm that Mr. Morris owns. The other parts of his farm aren't in our area. On Hardings is one detached house and one big barn where Mr. Morris keeps his square bales of hay and equipment. To get to Hardings you have to go down a rough 200 metre track with arable fields each side. Gerry Kew lives there now. He is a local vet, and before him Don Morton lived there-he works on Mr. Morris' farm. Hardings isn't on the mains water supply, but gets its' water from a well with electric pumps which pump water into two or three water tanks in the roof.
